columns.text: In this problem, we will compare two projects by comparing their net present values.
In this project, we will use an annuity table for the annuity factor. In this case, the factor for a six-year project with expected return of $8\%$ is $3.31213$

For System A, the Operating cash flow is:

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Operating cash flow}&=\$73,000 \times(1-0.21)\\
&+\dfrac{\$265,000}{4}\times 0.21\\[15 pt]

&=\$71,582.50
\end{aligned}$$

For System B, the Operating cash flow is:

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Operating cash flow}&=\$67,000\times(1-0.21)\\
&+\dfrac{\$345,000}{6}\times 0.21\\[15 pt]

&=\$65,005
\end{aligned}$$

Now that we have the operating cash flow, we can solve for the net present value of both systems using the formula in Step 2.

For System A:

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Net present value}&=-\$71,582.50 \times 3.31213-\$265,000\\[15 pt]
&=-\$502,090.55
\end{aligned}$$

The net present value for System A is $-\$502,090.55$

For System B:

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Net present value}&=-\$65,005\times 3.31213-\$345,000\\[15 pt]
&=-\$560,305.01
\end{aligned}$$

The net present value for System B is $-\$560,305.01$

Now that we have the values for the net present value of each system, we can see that the Net present value of **System A** is higher than that of B. This means that **System A** is the better choice in this scenario.
